Position the selector drum into the crankcase.

body.body: Fit the detent wheel engaging the wheel with the locator pin in the selector drum. Tighten a new fixing to
Assemble the detent arm as noted during removal and position to the crankcase.

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Installation (cfao_2)

body.body: Hold the detent arm assembly in position and fit a new fixing. Start the thread and push the detent arm, using finger pressure, to locate on the detent wheel. Ensure the detent arm remains correctly located on the detent wheel. Tighten the capscrew to
Rotate the selector drum and ensure a smooth movement. Rectify as necessary.
Using clean engine oil, lubricate the bearing and lip of the seal on the gear change shaft.
Lubricate, with a 50/50 solution of engine oil and molybdenum disulphide grease, both sides of the fingers of the selector mechanism on the gear change shaft.
Take care to avoid damaging the lip of the seal when inserting the gear change shaft into the crankcase. A damaged seal will lead to oil loss and could result in engine damage.

Feed the washer onto the shaft and insert the gear change shaft into the crankcase. Gently push the gear pedal end of the shaft through the bearing and seal located, at the gear pedal end, in the crankcase.

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Installation (cgwj_1)

body.body: Ensure that the pivot plate locates over the detent wheel and that the spring fits over the abutment bolt.

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Installation (cfao_3)

body.body: Fit the large washer and E-clip to the gear pedal end of the gear change shaft.

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Installation (kakh_1)

body.body: Fit the gear pedal crank to the shaft in the same orientation as noted prior to removal. Tighten the fixing to
Position the selector drum in the neutral position.
Check that the detent arm locates in the raised profile in the detent wheel (neutral position).

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Installation (kaks_2)

body.body: The selector forks can be fitted incorrectly. Ensure the position and orientation of the selector forks are the same as noted during removal. Incorrect fitting of the selector forks will cause damage to the transmission when changing gear.

Push the selector shaft into the crankcase from the selector shaft plug end. As the shaft is inserted locate the selector forks and also fit new circlips. Ensure the forks are fitted in the positions noted during removal.
